channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024050660
item.description:
Report E-2024050660

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN3265 Kleen MCT115 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to assist with containment. XPO terminal personnel advised all material released from the damaged pail and the pail was placed into a poly lined metal drum. Contractors arrived onsite and transferred the damaged container into a 55-gallon poly drum. The metal drum was neutralized and wiped down. Contractors did not locate evidence of a release to the trailer floor. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report E-2024050659
item.description:
Report E-2024050659

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 23, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon pails of UN2735 were crushed in transit and released approximately 1.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean the area. The damaged pails and all UN3082 impacted material were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon steel drum and one (1) 15-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024050685
item.description:
Report E-2024050685

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 22, 2024, one (1) 50-pound super sack of sodium chlorate was torn in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew patched the impacted bag and utilized hand tools to remediate the loading dock floor. All sodium chlorate (UN1495) impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 5-gallon poly container.

item.title: Report E-2024050652
item.description:
Report E-2024050652

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and pads to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into sixteen (16) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum was containerized in 85-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024050645
item.description:
Report E-2024050645

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-18
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 18, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote was punctured in transit and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel performed a tote transfer, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to manage the release. All waste was containerized in nine (9) 35-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024050710
item.description:
Report E-2024050710

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: Brewster
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wheeling and Lake Erie Railway
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When tank car PROX 44601 was in the WLE Brewster Car Shop for routine repairs, the carmen used a gas detection meter to check the top of the car for leaks after noticing an odor coming from the car. When they inserted the gas meter inside of the protective housing, the gas meter gave an alarm. They called myself, John Vergis Environmental Officer for the WLE, to come out and look at the car. I determined that the Vacuum Relief device was leaking around the O Ring Seal. I have called the car owner to see how they want to proceed with repairs. As of 5-29-2024, I have not yet heard back from them.

item.title: Report E-2024050625
item.description:
Report E-2024050625

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured box containing hazardous product, Thermaline 450 EP Part B. The puncture was a result of improper loading / forklift puncture. This resulted in approximately 5-ounces of product releasing onto the steel dock apron in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and overpacked the damaged leaking box of product. One 55-gallon DF was generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024050459
item.description:
Report E-2024050459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO- Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 55-gallon poly drum containing Dupham SPD. The drum was punctured in a forklift accident. This resulted in approximately 4-gallons of product releasing onto the wooden trailer floor, the steel apron, and the concrete dock floor. The surface areas were impacted as follows: Trailer Floor: 8'x3'/ Dock: 6'x6' / Apron: 6'x3'. A Contractor overpacked the damaged, leaking drum into one 85- gallon DF. The release was neutralized and cleaned-up using oil dry. The spill debris was containerized into a one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident
